metadata.titleEn: Geochemical data set of late Early Cretaceous granites in NIMA area, central Tibet
metadata.description: The data in this paper include major and trace elements, zircon U-Pb ages and HF isotopes, and detrital zircon U-Pb ages. The samples were collected from basalt and andesite in the Salt Lake area of Western Tibet. Zircon U-Pb geochronology, zircon trace and zircon Hf isotope data were obtained by laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry. The major and trace geochemical data of the whole rock are obtained by X-ray fluorescence spectrometry and inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry. The age, origin and formation background of magmatism in the region can be defined by the data obtained.
metadata.instructions: All data are stored in Excel file: the file name is upb.xls, which represents radioisotope U-Pb data; Zirt.xls represents zircon trace data, and wrmt.xls represents whole rock major and trace geochemical data; Hf.xls represents Hf isotopic data of zircon

literatureList.titleEn: Tetrad effect of rare earth elements caused by fractional crystallization in high-silica granites: An example from central Tibet
literatureList.referenceEn: Shuai, X., Li, S.-M., Zhu, D.-C., Wang, Q., Zhang, L.-L., & Zhao, Z. (2021). Tetrad effect of rare earth elements caused by fractional crystallization in high-silica granites: An example from central Tibet. Lithos, 384-385, 105968. Retrieved from http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0024493721000049. doi:https://doi.org/10.1016/j.lithos.2021.105968

Feature Specification.Question: What are the features and methods used in collecting geochemical and isotopic data from volcanic rock samples in the context of early Cretaceous granites in central Tibet?
Feature Specification.Answer: whole-rock major and trace elements, zircon U–Pb ages, Hf isotopic data, laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry, X-ray fluorescence spectrometry, inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry

Definition.Question: What are '锆石U–Pb年龄和Hf同位素数据' and how are they collected in the context of geochemical datasets?
Definition.Answer: '锆石U–Pb年龄和Hf同位素数据' refer to zircon U–Pb ages and Hf isotope data, which are collected using laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry. These data types help in determining the age and isotopic composition of zircon minerals, providing insights into the timing and nature of geological processes.

Interpretation.Question: What underlying geological processes can be inferred from the geochemical data patterns of volcanic rocks collected from the Nyima region in central Tibet during the late Early Cretaceous?
Interpretation.Answer: The geochemical data patterns of volcanic rocks, including whole-rock major and trace elements, zircon U-Pb ages, and Hf isotopes, suggest information about the magmatic activity and its origins in the Nyima region. By analyzing these patterns, researchers can infer the age, genesis, and tectonic setting of magmatic activities, providing insights into the geological processes at play during the late Early Cretaceous period. The combination of zircon U-Pb geochronology and Hf isotopic compositions allows for detailed interpretations of crustal evolution and magma source characteristics.

Causal Antecedent.Question: What causes variations in the accuracy of geochemical data collection methods for volcanic rock samples in the central Tibet region during the Late Early Cretaceous?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: Variations in the accuracy of geochemical data collection methods may be caused by the techniques used, such as laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry for zircon U-Pb dating and isotope analysis, and X-ray fluorescence and inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry for whole-rock geochemistry. The challenges also stem from the geological complexity of the region, the preservation state of the samples, and the calibration and precision of the instruments used.

Causal Consequence.Question: What are the potential outcomes on the understanding of magmatic activity in a region when using laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS) for zircon U-Pb dating and Hf isotopic data collection?
Causal Consequence.Answer: Using LA-ICP-MS for zircon U-Pb dating and Hf isotopic data collection can lead to a more precise understanding of the timing, origin, and tectonic setting of magmatic activity in the region. By providing accurate age determinations and isotopic compositions, researchers can better constrain the geological history and processes that have shaped the area, including the nature of magma sources and the evolution of the crust.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What procedures are used to collect and analyze zircon U-Pb ages and Hf isotopic data in the context of geochemical studies of granitic rocks?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: Zircon U-Pb ages and Hf isotopic data are collected using laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS). This involves using a laser to sample zircon crystals and analyze their isotopic composition with a mass spectrometer, allowing researchers to determine the age and isotopic characteristics of the samples.
